response.message: I must say, this is *very* nice to see. Previously, the mechanics and policies were scattered between the FAQ page and various [faq] questions on meta. The new privileges pages clearly state when it is appropriate or not to close, delete, and flag, and when a post becomes a wiki, which was not at all self-explanatory. It should be linked to from the FAQ page (once they're finalized).
It would be nice to have link to privileges page on one owns user page.
Sweet!  Just in time for my 10k!
Too good! You guys rock too hard!
Amazing work! Very well though off. I just wish I had something like this when my REP was building up! ;) I'm just one to go! ;)

On the subject of privileges, shouldn't it be possible to share these across related sites? For example, if you're a 50k user on SO, surely that indicates you can be trusted with some tasks on superuser.com. I've found it frustrating when I want to comment on a question in a programming-related site only to find I haven't got enough reps and yet I have more than sufficient reps on SO.
@Alex you get a +100 bonus on every site when you have at least +200 in any site on the network.
@jeff thanks for clarifying that! And a pretty neat way of handling the issue.
